    • Method Detail

      • getStatus

        public ApiTypes.EmailJobStatus getStatus(String transactionID,
                                         Boolean showFailed,
                                         Boolean showSent,
                                         Boolean showDelivered,
                                         Boolean showPending,
                                         Boolean showOpened,
                                         Boolean showClicked,
                                         Boolean showAbuse,
                                         Boolean showUnsubscribed,
                                         Boolean showErrors,
                                         Boolean showMessageIDs)
                                  throws Exception
        Get email batch status
        Parameters:
        apikey - ApiKey that gives you access to our SMTP and HTTP API's.
        transactionID - Transaction identifier
        showFailed - Include Bounced email addresses.
        showSent - Include Sent email addresses.
        showDelivered - Include all delivered email addresses.
        showPending - Include Ready to send email addresses.
        showOpened - Include Opened email addresses.
        showClicked - Include Clicked email addresses.
        showAbuse - Include Reported as abuse email addresses.
        showUnsubscribed - Include Unsubscribed email addresses.
        showErrors - Include error messages for bounced emails.
        showMessageIDs - Include all MessageIDs for this transaction
        Returns:
        ApiTypes.EmailJobStatus
        Throws:
        Exception

      • send

        public ApiTypes.EmailSend send(String subject,
                               String from,
                               String fromName,
                               String sender,
                               String senderName,
                               String msgFrom,
                               String msgFromName,
                               String replyTo,
                               String replyToName,
                               ApiTypes.StringArray to,
                               String[] msgTo,
                               String[] msgCC,
                               String[] msgBcc,
                               ApiTypes.StringArray lists,
                               ApiTypes.StringArray segments,
                               String mergeSourceFilename,
                               String channel,
                               String bodyHtml,
                               String bodyText,
                               String charset,
                               String charsetBodyHtml,
                               String charsetBodyText,
                               ApiTypes.EncodingType encodingType,
                               String template,
                               Iterable<FileData> attachmentFiles,
                               HashMap<String,String> headers,
                               String postBack,
                               HashMap<String,String> merge,
                               String timeOffSetMinutes,
                               String poolName,
                               Boolean isTransactional)
                        throws Exception
        Submit emails. The HTTP POST request is suggested. The default, maximum (accepted by us) size of an email is 10 MB in total, with or without attachments included. For suggested implementations please refer to https://elasticemail.com/support/http-api/
        Parameters:
        apikey - ApiKey that gives you access to our SMTP and HTTP API's.
        subject - Email subject
        from - From email address
        fromName - Display name for from email address
        sender - Email address of the sender
        senderName - Display name sender
        msgFrom - Optional parameter. Sets FROM MIME header.
        msgFromName - Optional parameter. Sets FROM name of MIME header.
        replyTo - Email address to reply to
        replyToName - Display name of the reply to address
        to - List of email recipients (each email is treated separately, like a BCC). Separated by comma or semicolon. We suggest using the "msgTo" parameter if backward compatibility with API version 1 is not a must.
        msgTo - Optional parameter. Will be ignored if the 'to' parameter is also provided. List of email recipients (visible to all other recipients of the message as TO MIME header). Separated by comma or semicolon.
        msgCC - Optional parameter. Will be ignored if the 'to' parameter is also provided. List of email recipients (visible to all other recipients of the message as CC MIME header). Separated by comma or semicolon.
        msgBcc - Optional parameter. Will be ignored if the 'to' parameter is also provided. List of email recipients (each email is treated seperately). Separated by comma or semicolon.
        lists - The name of a contact list you would like to send to. Separate multiple contact lists by commas or semicolons.
        segments - The name of a segment you would like to send to. Separate multiple segments by comma or semicolon. Insert "0" for all Active contacts.
        mergeSourceFilename - File name one of attachments which is a CSV list of Recipients.
        channel - An ID field (max 191 chars) that can be used for reporting [will default to HTTP API or SMTP API]
        bodyHtml - Html email body
        bodyText - Text email body
        charset - Text value of charset encoding for example: iso-8859-1, windows-1251, utf-8, us-ascii, windows-1250 and more…
        charsetBodyHtml - Sets charset for body html MIME part (overrides default value from charset parameter)
        charsetBodyText - Sets charset for body text MIME part (overrides default value from charset parameter)
        encodingType - 0 for None, 1 for Raw7Bit, 2 for Raw8Bit, 3 for QuotedPrintable, 4 for Base64 (Default), 5 for Uue note that you can also provide the text version such as "Raw7Bit" for value 1. NOTE: Base64 or QuotedPrintable is recommended if you are validating your domain(s) with DKIM.
        template - The ID of an email template you have created in your account.
        attachmentFiles - Attachment files. These files should be provided with the POST multipart file upload, not directly in the request's URL. Should also include merge CSV file
        headers - Optional Custom Headers. Request parameters prefixed by headers_ like headers_customheader1, headers_customheader2. Note: a space is required after the colon before the custom header value. headers_xmailer=xmailer: header-value1
        postBack - Optional header returned in notifications.
        merge - Request parameters prefixed by merge_ like merge_firstname, merge_lastname. If sending to a template you can send merge_ fields to merge data with the template. Template fields are entered with {firstname}, {lastname} etc.
        timeOffSetMinutes - Number of minutes in the future this email should be sent
        poolName - Name of your custom IP Pool to be used in the sending process
        isTransactional - True, if email is transactional (non-bulk, non-marketing, non-commercial). Otherwise, false
        Returns:
        ApiTypes.EmailSend
        Throws:
        Exception

      • status

        public ApiTypes.EmailStatus status(String messageID)
                            throws Exception
        Detailed status of a unique email sent through your account. Returns a 'Email has expired and the status is unknown.' error, if the email has not been fully processed yet.
        Parameters:
        apikey - ApiKey that gives you access to our SMTP and HTTP API's.
        messageID - Unique identifier for this email.
        Returns:
        ApiTypes.EmailStatus
        Throws:
        Exception

      • view

        public ApiTypes.EmailView view(String messageID)
                        throws Exception
        View email
        Parameters:
        messageID - Message identifier
        Returns:
        ApiTypes.EmailView
        Throws:
        Exception
